page.title: 05LOCAL GOVERNMENT, KETTLEWELL
page.content: Kettlewell has a Parish Council with an elected chairman and secretary. All those on the electoral roll of the village are entitled to attend and vote. Those owning holiday cottages are welcome to attend but may not vote. The Council discusses and makes decisions on matters of village concern and interest. Major decisions are taken by Craven District Council, the Yorkshire Dales National Park (especially on planning matters) and North Yorkshire County Council. For many years the area has been in a parliamentary constituency which has returned a Conservative Member of Parliament. The Division is now called Skipton and Ripon.
